title: May Garden Prep Guide: Essential Tips for Preparing Your Garden for Planting

tasks.task: Preparing the garden for May planting
subtasks: Clear winter debris from garden beds
Enrich soil with compost or manure
Plan garden layout, considering companion planting
Check irrigation system for planting season
Position garden beds for adequate sunlight
Select plants suitable for May and local climate
Rotate crops to prevent soil depletion
Add mulch around plants to retain moisture and control weeds
Plan for vertical growth using trellises and stakes
Label plants for variety tracking
Check and adjust irrigation as needed
Monitor plant health and watering requirements
Maintain garden layout and structure
Manage any post-planting debris or weeds

tasks.task: Preparing the garden for May planting
subtasks: Clear winter debris such as dead leaves, twigs, and old mulch
Enrich the soil by mixing in compost or well-rotted manure
Plan the garden layout, considering companion planting and crop rotation
Check the watering system to ensure it's ready for the growing season
Position the garden beds to receive adequate sunlight
Choose suitable plants for the climate and season (e.g., tomatoes, peppers, marigolds)
Add mulch around plants to retain moisture and reduce weeds
Plan for vertical growth using trellises and stakes
Label plants to track varieties
Check the irrigation system for any adjustments needed
Monitor plant health and adjust watering as necessary
Manage the garden's structure and layout
Address any post-planting debris or weeds
